27411.name: Holger G. Weiss

27431.bio:
I am a 19 year old entrepreneur who is thinking of new ideas to make this world a better place. I Conceptualize, Innovate and then work on Executing world changing ideas. I love building and rebuilding Products. Using creativity, ideas and magic, I build products in a way you’ll never forget. 

I started out by curating Technology news at the age of 12. After crossing 200,000 readers - I moved on to developing mobile apps when I was just 13 , since then I haven't looked back and have helped create various start-ups and have reached a user base of over 1,000,000 . I consult, advise and help execute on start-ups on a daily basis. I also occasionally speak at universities and corporates about entrepreneurship.
27431.name: Evan Luthra

27485.bio:
Andrew Hoag is a Managing Director of Startup Institute, where he manages their European presence out of Berlin and oversees their global products. Startup Institute helps individuals gain the skills, mindset, and network to succeed at careers in digital businesses. 

Andrew has been a successful founder, investor and advisor to award-winning start-ups, exiting his first company in 2012. He has spent more than 20 years in the technology business, including engineering supercomputers for NASA and securing banks for VeriSign.
27485.name: Andrew Hoag

27593.bio:
Who I am:
Strategic Planning Executive with strong ties in Creative Planning and Branding. Experienced in building brands through visionary thinking, branding strategies, communication strategies and brand implementation throughout companies. Over 17 years experiences in Germany's Top 10 independent, creative agencies. Strongly interested in User-Centric Organisation/Business Development.
Very good at analysis and interpretation, creative thinking, coupling pragmatic vision with evangelism, working in a fast pace environment, assertiveness, process and implementation orientation, team leadership, motivation and training.
What I like:
Planning for People, because people have always fascinated me. Finding human truths and building communication solutions as well as product and service design innovations on this proven knowledge (and on common sense!) is therefore crucial to my kind of planning.
27593.name: Stefanie Kuhnhen

27594.bio: Mobile and digital Advertising Executive with strong ties to Psychology and Neuro-Leadership. Many years of Sales, international Consulting, Business Development, Marketing and Market Research experience covering Online Media, Agencies, Top 5 Consultancies and Mobile Telecommunications. Lived and worked in Germany, US, Spain and Australia. Experienced in building up international sales organizations, digital leadership, significant online advertising and mobile Telco deals. Prior positions held with msn, Price Waterhouse Coopers, Nielsen/Netratings, and OgilvyOne in Australia and in Germany. Studies of Psychology in Australia.
27594.name: Markus von der Lühe

27605.bio:
Sarah Willis was born in Maryland, USA and holds dual citizenship, British and American.

Her father was a foreign correspondent and her family lived in the USA, Tokyo and Moscow before moving to England when she was 13. She began playing the horn aged 14 at school and then attended the Royal College of Music Junior Department. She went on to study full time at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama, where her teachers included Anthony Halstead and Jeff Bryant.

She later studied with Fergus McWilliam in Berlin, where she became 2nd Horn in the Berlin State Opera under Daniel Barenboim in 1991. During this time, Sarah played as a guest with many top orchestras such as Chicago Symphony, London Symphony and the Sydney Symphony Orchestra and performed worldwide as a soloist and in various chamber music ensembles.

In 2001 Sarah Willis joined the Berlin Philharmonic, becoming the first female member of the brass section. She has recorded various acclaimed CDs including works such as the Brahms Horn Trio and the Rosetti Double Horn Concertos as well as the much celebrated CDs Opera! and Four Corners! with the Berlin Philharmonic Horns.

Sarah is involved in Zukunft@BerlinPhil Education projects and enjoys creating and presenting BPh concerts for children. She also interviews conductors and soloists for the BPh´s Digital Concert Hall and in 2011 she presented live to 33 million viewers during the Final Concert of the YouTube Symphony Orchestra.
27605.name: Sarah Willis

27617.bio:
Uwe Vogel became skilled worker in semiconductor microelectronics (Funkwerk Erfurt) in 1983, received diploma in information technology (TU Chemnitz) in 1991, doctoral degree in biomedical engineering in 1999 (TU Dresden). After visiting Center for Applied Optics Studies at Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology (Terre Haute/Indiana, 1992) and a position in hearing research at Dresden University hospital (1995-1998) he has been with Fraunhofer Institute for Photonic Microsystems (IPMS) in Dresden/Germany since 1998, starting there as analog IC designer. Since 2000 he has managed the Analog/Mixed-Signal IC design group, and later on has founded and developed OLED-on-Silicon activities mainly focusing on the design of process technology (Silicon-OLED integration), devices and applications. Beside that, he has gained experience in active-matrix backplanes, 
OLED displays (microdisplay and 3D displays), OLED display driver IC, high-speed data transmission, and MEMS-CMOS integration. In 2010 he has been appointed head of the newly formed business unit "OLED microdisplays and sensors", which has continued inside Fraunhofer Institution for Organics, Materials and Electronic Devices Dresden (COMEDD), spun out in 2012. He has been coordinator of several collaborative projects on OLED microdisplays at European and national levels.
27617.name: Uwe Vogel

27710.bio: Marc Ennemann has over 12 years industry and consulting experience in the areas of organizational & process optimization as well as IT management and was mainly responsible for complex projects, starting from strategy up to operationalize processes. As part of his role as Head of Telecommunication, Mr. Ennemann is responsible for developing digital business models in converging markets and across various industries. Moreover, Marc is responsible for the development of diverse consulting services associated with corporate digital transformation. A related study titled "Survival of the Smartest" has recently been released. His passion is especially his three kids as well as diverse sports like football and skiing.
27710.name: Marc Ennemann

27714.bio:
Peggy Anne Salz is the lead analyst and founder of MobileGroove, a top 50 ranked influential destination producing custom research, strategic Thought Leadership and knowledge resources for the global mobile industry. She is also a Gigaom Research mobile analyst, where her focus is mobile loyalty, engagement and contextual commerce.

Peggy has written nine books about mobile, both as a lead author and in partnership with companies including SAP Mobile Services, Gemalto and InMobi, examining topics ranging from mobile marketing to mobile payments. Her latest book, Apponomics: The Insider's Guide to a Billion Dollar App Business, provides developers with an advanced guide to marketing and monetizing their apps. Her next book focuses on the impact of 'connectedness' on life, work and society.
27714.name: Peggy Anne Salz
